segment.source: Sideload LOB apps in Windows 10 (Windows 10)
segment.target: Sideload LOB apps in Windows 10 (Windows 10)

segment.source: Sideload line-of-business apps in Windows 10.
segment.target: Sideload line-of-business apps in Windows 10.

segment.source: Sideload LOB apps in Windows 10
segment.target: Sideload LOB apps in Windows 10

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: "Line-of-Business" (LOB) apps are present in a wide range of businesses and organizations.
segment.target: "Line-of-Business" (LOB) apps are present in a wide range of businesses and organizations.

segment.source: Organizations value these apps because they solve problems unique to each business.
segment.target: Organizations value these apps because they solve problems unique to each business.

segment.source: When you sideload an app, you deploy a signed app package to a device.
segment.target: When you sideload an app, you deploy a signed app package to a device.

segment.source: You maintain the signing, hosting, and deployment of these apps.
segment.target: You maintain the signing, hosting, and deployment of these apps.

segment.source: Sideloading was also available with Windows 8 and Windows 8.1
segment.target: Sideloading was also available with Windows 8 and Windows 8.1

segment.source: In Windows 10, sideloading is different than in earlier versions of Windows:
segment.target: In Windows 10, sideloading is different than in earlier versions of Windows:

segment.source: You can unlock a device for sideloading using an enterprise policy, or through Settings
segment.target: You can unlock a device for sideloading using an enterprise policy, or through Settings

segment.source: License keys are not required
segment.target: License keys are not required

segment.source: Devices do not have to be joined to a domain
segment.target: Devices do not have to be joined to a domain

segment.source: Requirements
segment.target: Requirements

segment.source: Here's what you'll need to have:
segment.target: Here's what you'll need to have:

segment.source: Devices need to be unlocked for sideloading (unlock policy enabled)
segment.target: Devices need to be unlocked for sideloading (unlock policy enabled)

segment.source: Certificate assigned to app
segment.target: Certificate assigned to app

segment.source: Signed app package
segment.target: Signed app package

segment.source: And here's what you'll need to do:
segment.target: And here's what you'll need to do:

segment.source: Turn on sideloading - you can push a policy with an MDM provider, or you can use Settings.
segment.target: Turn on sideloading - you can push a policy with an MDM provider, or you can use Settings.

segment.source: Trust the app - import the security certificate to the local device.
segment.target: Trust the app - import the security certificate to the local device.

segment.source: Install the app - use PowerShell to install the app package.
segment.target: Install the app - use PowerShell to install the app package.

segment.source: How do I sideload an app on desktop
segment.target: How do I sideload an app on desktop

segment.source: You can sideload apps on managed or unmanaged devices.
segment.target: You can sideload apps on managed or unmanaged devices.

segment.source: To turn on sideloading for managed devices
segment.target: To turn on sideloading for managed devices

segment.source: Deploy an enterprise policy.
segment.target: Deploy an enterprise policy.

segment.source: To turn on sideloading for unmanaged devices
segment.target: To turn on sideloading for unmanaged devices

segment.source: Open Settings.
segment.target: Open Settings.

segment.source: Click Update & SecurityFor developers.
segment.target: Click Update & SecurityFor developers.

segment.source: On Use developer features, select Sideload apps.
segment.target: On Use developer features, select Sideload apps.

segment.source: To import the security certificate
segment.target: To import the security certificate

segment.source: Open the security certificate for the appx package, and select Install Certificate.
segment.target: Open the security certificate for the appx package, and select Install Certificate.

segment.source: On the Certificate Import Wizard, select Local Machine.
segment.target: On the Certificate Import Wizard, select Local Machine.

segment.source: Import the certificate to the Trusted Root Certification Authorities folder.
segment.target: Import the certificate to the Trusted Root Certification Authorities folder.

segment.source: -OR-
segment.target: -OR-

segment.source: You can use a runtime provisioning package to import a security certificate.
segment.target: You can use a runtime provisioning package to import a security certificate.

segment.source: For information about applying a provisioning package to a Windows 10 device, see runtime instructions on Build and apply a provisioning package.
segment.target: For information about applying a provisioning package to a Windows 10 device, see runtime instructions on Build and apply a provisioning package.

segment.source: To install the app
segment.target: To install the app

segment.source: From the folder with the appx package, run the PowerShell command to install the appx package.
segment.target: From the folder with the appx package, run the PowerShell command to install the appx package.

segment.source: How do I sideload an app on mobile
segment.target: How do I sideload an app on mobile

segment.source: You can sideload apps on managed or unmanaged devices.
segment.target: You can sideload apps on managed or unmanaged devices.

segment.source: To turn on sideloading for a managed device
segment.target: To turn on sideloading for a managed device

segment.source: Deploy an enterprise policy.
segment.target: Deploy an enterprise policy.

segment.source: To turn on sideloading for unmanaged devices
segment.target: To turn on sideloading for unmanaged devices

segment.source: Open Settings.
segment.target: Open Settings.

segment.source: Click Update & SecurityFor developers.
segment.target: Click Update & SecurityFor developers.

segment.source: On Use developer features, select Sideload apps.
segment.target: On Use developer features, select Sideload apps.

segment.source: To import the security certificate for managed devices
segment.target: To import the security certificate for managed devices

segment.source: Open the security certificate for the appx package, and select Install Certificate.
segment.target: Open the security certificate for the appx package, and select Install Certificate.

segment.source: On the Certificate Import Wizard, select Local Machine.
segment.target: On the Certificate Import Wizard, select Local Machine.

segment.source: Import the certificate to the Trusted Root Certification Authorities folder.
segment.target: Import the certificate to the Trusted Root Certification Authorities folder.

segment.source: To import the security certificate for unmanaged devices
segment.target: To import the security certificate for unmanaged devices

segment.source: You can use a runtime provisioning package to import a security certificate.
segment.target: You can use a runtime provisioning package to import a security certificate.

segment.source: For information about applying a provisioning package to a Windows 10 mobile device, see runtime instructions on Build and apply a provisioning package.
segment.target: For information about applying a provisioning package to a Windows 10 mobile device, see runtime instructions on Build and apply a provisioning package.

segment.source: To install the app
segment.target: To install the app

segment.source: From an email, tap a xap, appx, or appx bundle package.
segment.target: From an email, tap a xap, appx, or appx bundle package.

segment.source: -OR-
segment.target: -OR-

segment.source: With your mobile device tethered to a desktop, click a xap, appx, or appx bundle package from the files system to install the app.
segment.target: With your mobile device tethered to a desktop, click a xap, appx, or appx bundle package from the files system to install the app.
